columns.text: In this problem, we need to determine if the lockbox project will be accepted and then calculate the net annual savings if the service is adopted.

The average daily collections are the product of the number of checks received times and the average value of a check. So, 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Average daily collections}&=5,100\cdot \$125\\
&=\$637,500
\end{align*}$$

The present value of the lockbox service is the product of the average daily receipts and the number of days the collection is reduced. So, 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Present value}&=\$637,500\cdot 2\\
&=\$1,275,000
\end{align*}$$

To calculate the NPV, we need to determine the present value  of the costs. This cost will be incurred every day forever.  The present value of the cost is the daily cost divided by the daily interest rate. So, 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{PV of the cost}&=\frac{\$175}{0.016\%}\\
&=\frac{\$175\cdot 100}{0.016}\\
&=\$1,093,750
\end{align*}$$

The NPV of lockbox can be calculated as follows 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{NPV }&=\text{PV}-\text{PV of the cost}\\
&=\$1,275,000-\$1,093,750\\
&=\$181,250
\end{align*}$$

Since the NPV is greater than zero, the company should take  the lockbox service.

The net annual savings excluding the cost would be the future value of the savings minus the savings. So, 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Annual savings}&=PV\cdot (1+0.00016)^{365}-PV\\
&=\$1,275,000\cdot 1.00016^{365}-\$1,275,000\\
&=\$76,670.87\\
\end{align*}$$

The annual cost can be calculated as follows
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Annual cost}&=\text{PV of the cost}\cdot(1+0.00016)^{365}-\text{PV of the cost}\\
&=\$1,093,750\cdot1.00016^{365}-\$1,093,750\\
&=\$1,159,521.58-\$1,093,750\\
&=\$65,771.58
\end{align*}$$

The annual net savings is the diference between the annual savings and the annual cost. So,  
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Annual net savings}&=\text{Annual savings}-\text{Annual cost}\\
&=\$76,670.87-\$65,771.58\\
&=\$9,899.29\\
&\approx\$9,899
\end{align*}$$
